title: Add 100/200/300/500-hour YTT course options across the directory filters and informational content

requirements.text: Update the Directory page training-hours filter to include a 100-hour option alongside the existing 200/300/500 options, so users can filter schools by 100-Hour YTT programs.

quotes: create these courses option ( 100-Hour YTT, 200-Hour YTT, 300-Hour YTT, 500-Hour YTT )

acceptanceCriteria: On `/` (`frontend/src/pages/DirectoryPage.tsx`), the filter checklist includes: 100 Hours, 200 Hours, 300 Hours, 500 Hours.
Selecting 100 Hours adds it to the active filters badges and filters the school results based on trainings with `hours == 100` (using the existing `useSchools(selectedHours)` behavior).
User-facing labels remain in English and match the existing pattern (e.g., "100 Hours").

requirements.text: Update home/Directory hero and informational copy that enumerates hour levels so it reflects the available hour categories including 100-Hour YTT.

quotes: create these courses option ( 100-Hour YTT, 200-Hour YTT, 300-Hour YTT, 500-Hour YTT )

acceptanceCriteria: The Directory hero subtitle on `frontend/src/pages/DirectoryPage.tsx` mentions 100, 200, 300, and 500-hour teacher training programs (English text).
In `frontend/src/components/directory/DirectoryInfoSections.tsx`, any text that currently lists only 200/300/500 is updated to include 100 as well (English text).

requirements.text: Extend the “Training Hour Levels Explained” informational section to include a 100-Hour YTT level entry consistent with the existing Card-based layout and styling.

quotes: create these courses option ( 100-Hour YTT, 200-Hour YTT, 300-Hour YTT, 500-Hour YTT )

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/components/directory/DirectoryInfoSections.tsx` includes a visible "100-Hour YTT" entry in the Training Hour Levels section, styled consistently with the existing 200/300/500 cards.
All new content is in English and does not introduce new backend dependencies.

constraints: Do not modify any immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, or any sources under `frontend/src/components/ui`).
Keep the Motoko backend single-actor architecture (all logic in `backend/main.mo`); no backend changes are required unless strictly necessary for this request.
nonGoals: Adding new backend data models for courses/training categories beyond the existing `Training.hours` field.
Implementing new admin-only validation rules that restrict which hour values are allowed for trainings.
Creating new pages or routes for course/category browsing beyond updating the existing directory filter and informational content.
